original:
<color_white>The Coolest Watch You've NEVER SEEN</color>™

This is undoubtedly the coolest looking watch you've ever seen before.  Its like something from a sci-fi TV show or a video game.  Its bands are a rich crimson-red leather on the outside and soft sheepskin on the inside, with a sturdy gold clasp on the end of one band and seven beautifully punctured holes at precise intervals on the other band.  Its body is a uniform  black disk with a nearly invisible compartment in the back for batteries.  Its glass faceplate functions as a button which calls forth the most user-friendly interface you've ever used describing all of its numerous functions all conveyed by an silly animated Magic-8 Ball that's saying <color_light_green>'No internet signal found.  Note: Lambda Protocol is active.  Go Team Zenture!'</color>

original:
Dear Editor,

The news of RivTech™ putting the G11 into production has stirred excitement among firearm aficionados like myself. The G11's reputation for innovation and its legendary design have long captivated enthusiasts. This move not only pays homage to the firearm's iconic legacy but also promises a thrilling experience for those eager to explore its cutting-edge features. Kudos to RivTech™ for taking this bold step, and I look forward to the day when the G11 becomes a reality in the hands of enthusiasts everywhere.
translation:
Dear Editor,

The news of RivTech™ putting the G11 into production has stirred excitement among firearm aficionados like myself. The G11's reputation for innovation and its legendary design have long captivated enthusiasts. This move not only pays homage to the firearm's iconic legacy but also promises a thrilling experience for those eager to explore its cutting-edge features. Kudos to RivTech™ for taking this bold step, and I look forward to the day when the G11 becomes a reality in the hands of enthusiasts everywhere.

original:
H&K and RivTech™ to Expand Factories, Re-Introduce G11 Caseless Technology

In a groundbreaking move, German arms manufacturers Heckler & Koch (H&K) and American startup RivTech™ are set to expand their factories to meet the rising demand for cutting-edge weaponry. RivTech™'s announcement includes licensing the never-before-developed G11, even hinting at possible civilian models in the future.

This partnership is expected to redefine the industry, bringing innovative firearm technology to the market and solidifying the collaboration between these two giants. As the expansion plans unfold, industry experts anticipate a new era in arms manufacturing, showcasing the potential of this strategic alliance.
translation:
H&K and RivTech™ to Expand Factories, Re-Introduce G11 Caseless Technology

In a groundbreaking move, German arms manufacturers Heckler & Koch (H&K) and American startup RivTech™ are set to expand their factories to meet the rising demand for cutting-edge weaponry. RivTech™'s announcement includes licensing the never-before-developed G11, even hinting at possible civilian models in the future.

This partnership is expected to redefine the industry, bringing innovative firearm technology to the market and solidifying the collaboration between these two giants. As the expansion plans unfold, industry experts anticipate a new era in arms manufacturing, showcasing the potential of this strategic alliance.

original:
H&K and RivTech™'s Factory Expansion Sparks Concerns Over Military Industrial Complex Growth

As Heckler & Koch (H&K) and RivTech™ unveil plans to expand their factories, progressives raise crucial questions about the unchecked growth of the military industrial complex. The licensing of the G11 caseless, prompts concerns over the prioritization of defense over essential social programs.

Critics argue that the focus should be on education, healthcare, and infrastructure, rather than fueling an ever-expanding arms race. While increased job opportunities are acknowledged, questions remain about the long-term impact of militarization on society.
translation:
H&K and RivTech™'s Factory Expansion Sparks Concerns Over Military Industrial Complex Growth

As Heckler & Koch (H&K) and RivTech™ unveil plans to expand their factories, progressives raise crucial questions about the unchecked growth of the military industrial complex. The licensing of the G11 caseless, prompts concerns over the prioritization of defense over essential social programs.

Critics argue that the focus should be on education, healthcare, and infrastructure, rather than fueling an ever-expanding arms race. While increased job opportunities are acknowledged, questions remain about the long-term impact of militarization on society.

Then, I ran here as quick as my feet could carry me and now I'm stuck here in the 0ruins of this public school, doing the best I can to help these guys keep the lights on.  I could probably rendezvous with my family if I wanted, but I want to make sure these people here are safe before I'd even consider leaving this place.  The people are here are nice and this place kind of grows on you.

I could probably rendezvous with my family if I wanted, but I want to make sure these people here are safe before I'd even consider leaving this place.  The people are here are nice and this place kind of grows on you.

original:
Investment Horizon Brightens as RivTech™ Expands Operations

Armaments startup RivTech™'s recent announcement of a substantial factory expansion, coupled with the licensing of the ground-breaking G11 caseless firearms technology from the venerable Heckler & Koch, has set the stage for enticing investment opportunities.

The G11's innovative design has never before been put into mass production and the possibility of civilian models present a unique market proposition, drawing attention from financial analysts and speculators alike.

RivTech™'s strategic moves position it as a key player in the evolving landscape of advanced weaponry, offering investors a chance to capitalize on the intersection of cutting-edge technology and military demand.
translation:
Investment Horizon Brightens as RivTech™ Expands Operations

Armaments startup RivTech™'s recent announcement of a substantial factory expansion, coupled with the licensing of the ground-breaking G11 caseless firearms technology from the venerable Heckler & Koch, has set the stage for enticing investment opportunities.

The G11's innovative design has never before been put into mass production and the possibility of civilian models present a unique market proposition, drawing attention from financial analysts and speculators alike.

RivTech™'s strategic moves position it as a key player in the evolving landscape of advanced weaponry, offering investors a chance to capitalize on the intersection of cutting-edge technology and military demand.

original: It is true that there are at least two separate alien invasion forces on Earth.  In all cases so far, the Xenoids have been hostile to these other strange aliens, known colloquially as Mi-Go's because of their striking similarity to the same creatures described by H.P. Lovecraft.  We have multiple confirmed reports of these Mi-Go's taking human prisoners as well as creating from nowhere buildings of organic resin.  While not as numerous as the Xenoids, the Mi-Go's are just as much of a threat to humanity. Thankfully they seem to be hostile to each other.
translation: It is true that there are at least two separate alien invasion forces on Earth.  In all cases so far, the Xenoids have been hostile to these other strange aliens, known colloquially as Mi-Go's because of their striking similarity to the same creatures described by H.P. Lovecraft.  We have multiple confirmed reports of these Mi-Go's taking human prisoners as well as creating from nowhere buildings of organic resin.  While not as numerous as the Xenoids, the Mi-Go's are just as much of a threat to humanity. Thankfully they seem to be hostile to each other.

original:
Its a funny story about a Mexican cartel drug front, a CIA Honey-pot, an FBI Reco case, and the Library of Congress's newspaper archives.

The Cartel was trying to launder their drug and human trafficking money here in the states by building this large indoor go-cart race track.  Apparently the head guys kids loved go-cart racing and he thought it would be the perfect cover.

Somehow a CIA agent had gotten within that specific cartel and were able to influence the cartel to invest far more money than they should have, and after which FBI collected all the bad guys the Federal Government had this building practically ready to open.  Not wanting anything to go watste,  the FBI ended up giving most of the floors to the Library of Congress to store newspapers, and some of the other usual suspects took their share too.

Once this cataclysm happened and much of the government was destroyed, this site was commandeered to coordinate local responses against the Xenoids.
translation:
Its a funny story about a Mexican cartel drug front, a CIA Honey-pot, an FBI Reco case, and the Library of Congress's newspaper archives.

The Cartel was trying to launder their drug and human trafficking money here in the states by building this large indoor go-cart race track.  Apparently the head guys kids loved go-cart racing and he thought it would be the perfect cover.

Somehow a CIA agent had gotten within that specific cartel and were able to influence the cartel to invest far more money than they should have, and after which FBI collected all the bad guys the Federal Government had this building practically ready to open.  Not wanting anything to go watste,  the FBI ended up giving most of the floors to the Library of Congress to store newspapers, and some of the other usual suspects took their share too.

Once this cataclysm happened and much of the government was destroyed, this site was commandeered to coordinate local responses against the Xenoids.

original: We don't exactly know what they are or how exactly they relate to the rest this cataclysm that has been happening.  From their tactics we can assume that the Xenoids are operating as a sort of paramilitary or an expeditionary force. They seem to favor melee weapons and shield rather than long range firearms, however they also are able to fire short range flechette darts.  As if that was bad enough these aliens have some mind-affecting abilities that I cannot explain at all.  Having said all that they are not immortal, we can make them bleed so we can make them die.
translation: We don't exactly know what they are or how exactly they relate to the rest this cataclysm that has been happening.  From their tactics we can assume that the Xenoids are operating as a sort of paramilitary or an expeditionary force. They seem to favor melee weapons and shield rather than long range firearms, however they also are able to fire short range flechette darts.  As if that was bad enough these aliens have some mind-affecting abilities that I cannot explain at all.  Having said all that they are not immortal, we can make them bleed so we can make them die.

original: We know of two types of Xenoid drones, reconnaissance and seeker drones.  Seeker drones do just that, seek out enemies and engage them.  Reconnaissance drones won't engage in combat unless cornered and if they are engaged they flee as quickly as possible.  Both types of drones are capable of emitting a bright light and temporarily blinding you, but seeker drones can also taze you.
translation: We know of two types of Xenoid drones, reconnaissance and seeker drones.  Seeker drones do just that, seek out enemies and engage them.  Reconnaissance drones won't engage in combat unless cornered and if they are engaged they flee as quickly as possible.  Both types of drones are capable of emitting a bright light and temporarily blinding you, but seeker drones can also taze you.

original: Well now that you mention it, I could use someone to act as point for a number of projects around the tower.  There is so much room around here to expand, and so many different ways to do so.  If you can go around and convince some people to move boxes around, then the Maquis can expand to add new facilities.  This can't be done instantaneously though, because everyone here already have jobs to do.  If you think everyone around here is completely stationary, think again.
translation: Well now that you mention it, I could use someone to act as point for a number of projects around the tower.  There is so much room around here to expand, and so many different ways to do so.  If you can go around and convince some people to move boxes around, then the Maquis can expand to add new facilities.  This can't be done instantaneously though, because everyone here already have jobs to do.  If you think everyone around here is completely stationary, think again.

original: Well there are several other directions that we could expand, but we can't do everything at once. First thing we need is to create a dedicated medical area.  So far, casualties are treated by comrades-in-arms during battle, or taken away for dedicated treatment.  What we need is several large areas where people can safely recover, and I have a few places in mind already.  I've also gotten requests from the lab-techs and scientists upstairs for additional resources so they can analyze the Xenoids technology and biology.  There is also talk about setting up dedicated areas as shooting ranges and for small-arms production.
translation: Well there are several other directions that we could expand, but we can't do everything at once. First thing we need is to create a dedicated medical area.  So far, casualties are treated by comrades-in-arms during battle, or taken away for dedicated treatment.  What we need is several large areas where people can safely recover, and I have a few places in mind already.  I've also gotten requests from the lab-techs and scientists upstairs for additional resources so they can analyze the Xenoids technology and biology.  There is also talk about setting up dedicated areas as shooting ranges and for small-arms production.

original: When I was on the evacuation bus I saw a group of these strange looking soldier types that were armed with swords and shields. I almost thought it was some kind of morbid live action role playing during the riots, until one of them looked directly at me.  I swear its eyes pulsed red, and I started having the worst panic attack I've ever had, it was as if the knight turned into a crusading Templar and I was a refugee outside the walls of Jerusalem.  If I hadn't already had an empty stomach I probably would have lost it.  It still haunts me.
translation: When I was on the evacuation bus I saw a group of these strange looking soldier types that were armed with swords and shields. I almost thought it was some kind of morbid live action role playing during the riots, until one of them looked directly at me.  I swear its eyes pulsed red, and I started having the worst panic attack I've ever had, it was as if the knight turned into a crusading Templar and I was a refugee outside the walls of Jerusalem.  If I hadn't already had an empty stomach I probably would have lost it.  It still haunts me.

original:
You and your team were out on a combat patrol and after sustaining casualties, you had hunkered down in an abandoned store for the night.

As your alarm wakes you, your teammates have sadly succumbed to their wounds.  Through the taped-up storefront windows, you can see multiple bandits preparing to attack, and amazingly you're being you noticed alien invaders, dubbed The Xenoids which were working together with these humans!

Incredibly, in the ongoing cataclysm, some desperate or deviant humans have decided to side with these Xenoids.  You must get to your local contact as soon as possible to report this turn of events. Also the building is now on fire.

This mission is Foxtrot Uniform Charlie Kilo.  Report back to base as soon as possible!
translation:
You and your team were out on a combat patrol and after sustaining casualties, you had hunkered down in an abandoned store for the night.

As your alarm wakes you, your teammates have sadly succumbed to their wounds.  Through the taped-up storefront windows, you can see multiple bandits preparing to attack, and amazingly you're being you noticed alien invaders, dubbed The Xenoids which were working together with these humans!

Incredibly, in the ongoing cataclysm, some desperate or deviant humans have decided to side with these Xenoids.  You must get to your local contact as soon as possible to report this turn of events. Also the building is now on fire.

This mission is Foxtrot Uniform Charlie Kilo.  Report back to base as soon as possible!
